text: please raise your right hand and repeat
after me I David a paterson do solemnly
swear I gave it a paterson do solemnly
swear David a patterson was sworn in
today as New York's 55th governor almost
exactly one week after it became public
that Eliot Spitzer had been caught in a
prostitution ring so help me God so help
me God the sense in the Capitol day was
one of I would say almost jubilation
Eliot Spitzer really had a contentious
relationship with the legislature
whereas David Paterson was a senator for
22 years he's someone that lawmakers
know and like now he's really going to
prove whether he can lead the state
through a very trying financial time we
are looking at an economy that is
reeling and I must say to all of you in
government and all of you in business
that you must meet with me in the next
couple of weeks and adjust our budget
accordingly it's going to be a very
difficult task to to bring the budget in
on time that the deadline is March 31st
that the new fiscal year begins on April
first and I think a lot of people are
even having a hard time just figuring
out how much revenue the state is going
to take in when there's so much
volatility on Wall Street let's face it
we rely a great deal on what comes out
of the financial community from wall
street and the the banks that pay big
taxes and
the stock exchange and so on and that
falling back as it now is will put us in
terms of revenues not what we would like
to be so obviously we have to deal with
that as opposed to governor Spitzer
about a very confrontational approach
with the legislature I I think most
people expect that David Paterson will
be much more of a conciliator he's
always been known as someone who could
strike deals who could reach across the
aisle he was the Senate Minority Leader
for several years so he's worked
directly with Joe Bruno the state's top
Republican so I think the expectation is
he's someone who will reach out to the
legislature as opposed to push them away
as Eliot Spitzer often did let us grab
the unusual opportunities that
circumstance has handed us today and put
personal politics party advantage and
power struggles aside in favor of
service in the interest of the people
talk to a bunch of the republican state
senators and they were enthusiastic
it's no secret they had a very poor
relationship with governor Spitzer and
so I think that they
look forward to a much better
relationship with Governor Paterson we
like I like David put a blurred lovely
they brought some life to thee to that
room and to the hopes of the people of
this great state over the next two weeks
everyone will be focusing on both the
budget and how it unfolds what will he
do with spending you know again this is
a very difficult fiscal environment
really hold the line on spending or you
know as many people think will really
allow spending to grow and have more
liberal policies like many people expect
you will
